deck: Tony Chu, the cibopathic federal agent with the ability to get psychic impressions from what he eats, is back in action, just in time to face a cult of egg-worshipping terrorists who've declared holy war on the chicken-eaters of the world.
description: Collected in Chew: Bad Apples.
name: Bad Apples

deck:
Anthony and Antonelle Chu are fraternal twins. Tony and Toni. Each with their own extraordinary, albeit diametrically opposed, ability. Tony is cibopathic, able to get psychic sensations of the past of anything he bites into or ingests. Toni is cibovoyant, able to flash onto a vision of the future of any living thing she bit into or ingested.

Tony is alive. Toni is dead. Toni has been murdered. Tony has vowed to catch her killer. Toni is going to help.
description: Collected in Chew: Family Recipes.

deck: The Mist returns to Opal City for revenge on the original Golden-Age Starman, Ted Knight, and his family. He visits his revenge on Ted's sons, David and Jack, for the Sins of the Father.
description:
Young Jack Knight, collector and purveyor of things past, is reluctantly thrust into the family business, the super-hero business...

From the writer of The Golden Age, WildC.A.T.s, Team One and Leave It To Chance, James Robinson brings a new guardian of Opal City, Jack Knight, Starman.

This is the story of how Jack picks up his father, Ted's, mantle, after the murder of his brother David.

deck: Once a year, Starman Jack Knight and his late brother, David, Jack's predecessor as Opal's Guardian get together. David imparts wisdom from beyond the grave to help Jack become the Starman Opal needs.
description:
Following his murder by The Mist's son Kyle, David Knight returns to visit his brother, Jack, once a year to impart wisdom from beyond the grave to help Jack become the Starman Opal City needs.

In their first meeting they argue and engage in a little sibling rivalry to vent and blow off steam. In a cemetery.

In their second meeting, David takes Jack aboard a pirate ship and they sale with a skeleton crew into battle. David has a special gift for Jack for his birthday.

In their third meeting, David gathers Al (The Atom) Pratt, Dinah (The Black Canary) Lance, Charles (Dr. Mid-Nite) McNider, Rex (The Hourman) Tyler, Terry (Mr. Terrific) Sloane, Richard (The Red Bee) Raliegh and Giovanni "John" Zatara for a special dinner.

The next Talking With David is between Mikaal Tomas and David, while Jack and Mikaal are battling a new iteration of Solomon Grundy; while on a larger quest to find William Payton. David inspires Mikaal to be the Starman he can be.

David and Jack talk again in 2001, where David is joined by Ted Knight and Kent and Inza Nelson. As well as The Mist's son Kyle.

During The Blackest Night, a Black Lantern Ring finds David and raises his physical body from the dead. He confronts The Shade and is defeated by him. David's body is returned to eternal rest.
name: Talking With David

issues.name: Fighting with Grundy; Talking with David '99

deck: Lois Lane discovers Clark Kent's secret, leaving Superman without a secret identity.

Overview

Truth is a multi-month crossover between Superman, Action Comics, Batman/Superman and Superman/Wonder Woman. The story arc had a prologue in DC's 2015 Free Comic Book Day offering Divergence, but wouldn't begin until June 2015.

deck: When the heroes from another reality comes after Batman and Superman blaming them for a crime they didn't commit, both heroes will need all the help they can get from other realities to defeat the insane gamemasters behind this chaos.
description:
When a Superman and Batman appear one their world and claim that Skyscraper murdered Lois Lane, Superman kills Skyscraper and after the ensuing battle with the Maximums, escape via Boom tube.

With mysterious information provided by their fallen comrade, Bowman, the Maximums track Superman and Batman to their reality.

While Batman and Superman are fighting the Atomic Skull who is stealing a briefcase with radioactive materials in it from Wayne Tech, the Maximums appear, seeking revenge. The Soldier fires a bullet at the Skull, and it passes through Superman's hand and causing the Skull to violently release a large amount of radiation that Superman acts to contain. Although Robot observes Sueprman's heroic act, Viking will have none of it.

Soldier and Monster attempt to subdue Batman when Batzarro intervenes, blinding everyone with his "smoke" bombs. Batman's special batarang shocks Monster into breaking down into an inert monster and Becky, the little girl who merges with and controls him. As Superman crashes nearby, Batman leaps to take Becky to safety.

Viking using his axes, carved from black ice by Ymir, cutting Superman's skin, while Hornet flies into his ear and begins to grow... Viking strikes Superman down while Soldier kicks Batman into unconsciousness.

The Maximums return to their world via Boom Tube while Batzarro looks on.

Batman and Superman escape from a bizarre cell in the Maximums' reality. Back in new earth, Bizarro #1 and Batzarro somehow use the JLA transporter to attempt to reach Batman and Superman.

WHile battling Viking in San Franscisco, Superman is distracted by a woman being thrown from a bridge. Catching her, he realizes too late it's a set-up and is attacked by Robot, who no longer believes they murdered Skyscraper.

Meanwhile, Batman is wandering this reality's Alcatraz prison when he is attacked by an intelligent but feral Maximum, Wolfen and is defeated.

Bizarro ends up on a parallel earth, separated from Batzarro.

The Bowman visits Lex Luthor, who seems to know him. Bowman returns to the Maximums reality and releases the Kryptonite Man into an imprisoned Batman, possessing him.

The Kryptonite Man-possessed Batman fights with Superman while the Maximums argue over their fate. Superman uses Robot's exterior armor to encase K-Man and force him out of Batman's body.

Bizarro and Batzarro appear and try to drag their idols to safety, but Viking's axes cuts through Batzarro's chains, dropping him back to earth.

After Boom Tubing back to New earth, Bizarro appears on Paradise Island to recruit Supergirl's help in fighting the Maximums. Metron reminds Superman of his obligation to free Darkseid imprisoned in the Source wall.

It is revealed that The Joker and Mxy are playing a game with the heroes as game pieces. Mxy remarks that now that the pieces are all in place, the real game begins.

Superman frees Darkseid from the Source Wall.

Batman appears on a gender reversed earth and encounters Batwoman, Superwoman, and Superlad. Bizarro has somehow recruited various versions of Supergirl.

Everyone is eventually transported to a mysterious location that resembles a three ring circus. AFter killing Batzarro, The Joker reveals his plan to kill "every Batman there ever was or there ever will be."

It is revealed that the Joker and Mxy had create the Maximums and their reality as part of this game.

As everyone batlles one another, Mxy tricks Bizarro into activating a Phantom Zone projector on the Joker, freeing Bat-Mite who was apparently trapped inside him, empowering him. Mxy was unable to directly free his fellow 5th Dimensional imp, and had to have a creation of the Joker do it himself.

Mxy reveals to Darkseid his role in the coming crisis: "We ... have a future together that has yet to be revealed. "From the Fourth World ... into the Fifth Dimension." Kind like that ring tone, big D."

description: The streets of Gotham are dangerous at night, but not for Diana of Themyscira. When she sees Echidna, Mother of Monsters, attacking a local thug, she jumps into the fray-though she never expected to take Echidna's side. Dianaâs agreed to help Echidna rescue her kidnapped children, but when Harley Quinn perpetrates a high-profile kidnapping of her own, Batgirl demands Diana abandon her quest and help take Harley downâor else. How will Wonder Woman save all the children in time?
name: Echidna

description:
Wonder Woman has always been both warrior and diplomat. Now she works to bring peace to the central African nation of Itari, where a centuries-old conflict threatens to plunge the nation into a bloody civil war. Diplomacy was Diana's focus when she came to Itari to help foster peace between tribes engaged in centuries-old conflict. But first, she must defeat Ares and his Spartoi warriors.

Then Ares is confident that Wonder Woman will fail-even if by some miracle she defeats him in battle, the Itari people will never make peace amongst themselves. But Diana's convinced that both battles can be won!
name: Vendetta

description:
Dynamite's 2015 Crossover event involving an all-female writing team lead by Gail Simone crossing over their most notable female heroines and villains.

The event sees Red Sonja meeting up with a host of other familiar Dynamite & Chaos! Comics characters, including Dejah Thoris, Vampirella, Lady Rawhide, Jennifer Blood, Masquerade, Jungle Girl, Kato and more. They are all being threatened by an Evil that approaches their worlds, and theyâll find that the only things that can save their reality, are the legendary âSwords of Sorrowâ.
name: Swords of Sorrow

deck: After his final battle with the Joker, Batman is presumed dead, and after two months of his absence the Gotham City Police Department and Powers Industries decide the city needs a new Dark Knight, and recruit Commissioner James Gordon to don a robotic Batman suit in an effort to help the city.
description:
NOTE: This story arc is intended for the Scott Snyder/Greg Capullo Batman issues, not any other series featuring shared characters.

Overview

Superheavy is the Batman creative team of writer Scott Snyder and artist Greg Capullo's fifth full arc of the series, following the conclusion of Endgame, which ended in the apparent death of both Batman and Joker. The storyline debuted in DC's 2015 Free Comic Book Day offering Divergence FCBD Special Edition #1, where it was revealed that James Gordon was the man underneath the robotic Batsuit. The storyline would begin in full with the release of June 2015's Batman #41, and would shift tones and ideas for various other Batman related books during the same month.

deck: The Trench is the first story-arc of the Aquaman series in the New 52 relaunch, beginning his DCU canon following the history-changing events of Flashpoint.
description:
Dealing with a new menacing threat under the sea, a carnivorous race known as The Trench, it also solidifies the character's backstory in new continuity. It was written by Geoff Johns and illustrated by Ivan Reis. This marks an official return to his Silver Age origin story, removing the previous origin Time and Tide from canon.

The storyline takes place after Aquawar and is followed by The Others, both also written by Johns.
name: The Trench

deck: The Others is an Aquaman storyline written by Geoff Johns with illustrations by Ivan Reis. It is the second arc of Johns' series Aquaman (Volume 7), following his debut arc The Trench and preceding his Justice League crossover Throne of Atlantis. The story takes place in Prime Earth continuity as part of The New 52.
name: The Others

deck: Sea of Storms is an Aquaman storyline written by Jeff Parker with illustrations by Paul Pelletier. It is the fifth arc of Aquaman series (Volume 7), following the arc Death of a King and preceding by Maelstrom.
description: Aquaman faces a forgotten Atlantean legend: the Karaqan. A massive crustacean of incredible power, the Karaqan once served the King of Atlantis, but now poses one of his greatest threats. And when Aquamanâs trident is stolen, a host of ancient evils is freed from a mysterious portal along with the Greek demigod, Hercule. All this, and Arthur Curryâs high school reunion.
name: Sea of Storms

deck: A planetary war erupts between two worlds and the universe will be threatened to be dragged to a universal war. And who is profitting from an interplanetary chaos?
description:
Prologue

In the aftermath of Adam Strange: Planet Heist, Rann was located to Thanagar star sistem, However, Rann's new location caused the orbit of Thanagar to become unstable, and the planet crashed into the system's sun. The surviving Thanagarians and Rannians now all live on Rann, and tensions are high between the two groups, as each blames the other for their predicament. War between both factions erupts and other worlds are recruited in both sides, spreading the conflict depiste the efforts of intergalactic peacekeepers Green Lantern, Hawkwoman, Captain Comet, Starman, Adam Strange, Tygorr and the Omega Men and threatening to reach Earth.
name: Rann/Thanagar War
